title: Simple and elegant
comment: This is just such a nice straightforward simple everyday calculator!

title: Trig functions?
comment: Did I miss something? Where are the trig functions?

title: Simple, beautiful, efficient
comment: I love the design! Very simple calculator almost perfect at what it does. Only thing: PLEASE move the enter button to the right side.

title: Simple.
comment: Does all the things I need.

title: Perfect for my needs!
comment: I used fancy HP rpn scientific calculators in school and work back in the day, and find RPN very intuitive. These days I only ever do basic arithmetic and this is the perfect simple rpn calculator for that.

title: Lovely RPN calculator
comment: It took me a long time to find a nice one. Well done.

title: No frills
comment: "No frills" might sound like a criticism, but it's not. If all you want is a simple, easy to use RPN calculator with basic features and an uncluttered interface then this is the app for you. I love it.

title: Good work
comment: The square root button is not needed (it's just a matter of using 1/x and x^n)...you could replace with "%" which is really the only missing function! Please set the color to be theme independent or give us an option to choose. Great app! Thanks!

title: Good at being a simple RPN calculator but ...
comment: could you add 'DUP' to copy the top most stack? I know I can use copy and paste yet I think DUP is faster. Anyway, great app :-)

title: Love it!
comment: Fast startup, enough features. RPN, my way.

title: Works great
comment: Simple and functional.

title: Now I don't have to find my hp
comment: Good app for rpn calculations.

title: Not bad
comment: It lags a bit between me pressing a button and something happening (number displaying, function operating, etc.)

title: Excellent
comment: This is high quality! If you're looking for an rpn calculator this is the best choice!

title: Great app
comment: Its pretty simple and nice to calculate..
You need to set the display to show decimals. (Which it does by default, so at some point you must have switched it to zero decimal places.)
I like it
No support for exponential notation

title: Does what I need.
comment: It has more functions but I really love RPN for basic arithmetic and that's good enough for me.
Perfect!

title: Sweet
comment: Nice for those that want an RPN calculator.

title: Almost perfect
comment: The thing I might object against is the placement of the enter button. I would have preferred it to be horizontal rather than vertical for easier reach. But that is a very minor complaint.

title: Too big on a 10" Tablet
comment: Would Be nice as a popup floating half-screenapp. as a full- screen, it's too big on the buttons,too small on the text.

title: Nice, simple RPN calculator
comment: So, I have RealCalc, which offers an RPN mode, but for the life of me, I can't understand why it duplicates your entry in both x & y every time you hit enter.  The result is that you have to remember to use an operator on your last entry, rather than hit enter and then use an operator.  So I went looking for a simple RPN calculator for my everyday (non-scientific) needs, and this one works very well for that purpose.  My rating of five stars is based on the fact that it serves the purpose it was intended for - a simple RPN calculator - very well.  It has a multi-line display, and <enter> behaves the way I think it should.  And it's free (open source, also!)  Thank you!

title: Great App!
comment: Thank you so much for developing and then giving away this app for free!  It satisfies my needs nearly perfectly.  Maybe consider an UNDO?

title: Simple Multi-line RPN Calc
comment: This is a simple but effective multi-line RPN calculator. The simplicity reduces the key count and thus makes it easy to use on a small screen--unlike apps that are clones of HP scientific calculators. On my Galaxy Note II this isn't an issue, but I could see it being one on other phones.

title: The Best for simple calculations
comment: I'm used to rpn in my HP, but in my phone I don't need that much power and complexity. This app behaves as I'm used to but keeping it simple.

title: Great
comment: Would like to disable vibrate. Also, would be nice to automatically adjust decimal display to entered significant figures.

title: Easiest Fastest Calculator
comment: Excellent quick calculator and RPN remains the warp drive for embedded calcs. Rock solid operation on Droid.
Simple and good

title: favourite
comment: plain, simple, does everything right, nothing wrong

title: Fix the clicks!
comment: Just what I was looking for, but as another review mentions, the multiple click sounds when you hit a key are really annoying.
Simple, useful. Great app.
Useless

title: Perfect simple RPN
comment: Clean simple perfect with a real stack to work from.

title: Simple!
comment: Just like my old HP RPM CALC!. Great addition to my android phone.
Awesome!  Finally I don't have to switch between work calc brain and cell phone calc brain.

title: Calc
comment: Great for running quick numbers. I love the large keys and uncluttered screen.
Nice simple RPN calc. Only wish is that there was a swap button on the main set of keys. Not sure where it would go though...

title: Lacks critical functionality
comment: Cannot take square roots.

title: Perfect daily calculator!
comment: Once you've used rpn you can never go back. Thanks for the wonderful large buttons in lieu of functions that are never used. Bravo
Simple but good app... perfect for daily usage.

title: Great
comment: Great, simple RPN calculator. Just what I needed.

title: Drives me to distraction
comment: I like this calculator but I deleted it because of it's annoying clickity-click; it clicks multiple times with every entry!
Works good on Sidekick4G
RPN calculator with huge buttons, easy to use with one thumb. Four register lines visible. No scientific functions.
Nice. Simple layout. Big buttons. For basic rpn math. No permissions needed. "Thanks" to the author.
Now , fits well on small screen X10 mini. Still ok after 1.6 update
I love this
I have been looking for a tenkey calculator and this one is close. If you develop a a real tenkey I am a customer.
Can't see the bottom line of number buttons on my model in portrait view (0, ., +/-, +)
This is the one I've been waiting for. An rpn calculator to replace the built in with buttons large enough to hit.
Not bad. Need to be able to run off the vibrate when hitting the keys.
Could not figure how 2 use this, no clear or = button, uninstalled.
Nice basic calc
Basic rpn is ok, but would much more useful if stack could be rotated (argument 2 --> arg 1). Looking fwd to next rev.
